meanings.definition: The condition of having an extra chromosome in a cell.
meanings.sent1: Trisomy can lead to genetic disorders.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed the baby with trisomy after genetic testing.
meanings.sent3: The cell party had an unexpected guest - trisomy!
meanings.sent4: In the chromosome dance, trisomy decided to bring an extra partner.
meanings.sent5: The cell felt crowded with trisomy crashing the party.

meanings.definition: The presence of three copies of a particular chromosome instead of the usual two.
meanings.sent1: Trisomy of chromosome 21 causes Down syndrome.
meanings.sent2: The genetic counselor explained the implications of trisomy to the parents.
meanings.sent3: The chromosome trio, trisomy, always stood out in the genetic lineup.
meanings.sent4: The extra chromosome played a game of musical chairs, and trisomy won.
meanings.sent5: The genetic code stuttered with trisomy's extra chromosome.
